title: The role of N6-methyladenosine associated genes in ischemic stroke risk: interplay with environmental factors.
abstract: Ischemic stroke is a leading cause of morbidity and mortality worldwide, resulting from a complex interplay between genetic predisposition and environmental exposures. Recent advances have highlighted the importance of epitranscriptomic regulation, particularly N6-methyladenosine (m
